experience.title: Java Software Engineer
experience.description: Project 1: Application Gateway Service‚Ä¢ Streamlined the security infrastructure by whitelisting the gateway application in the organization‚Äôs firewall, enabling seamless andsecure communication between external e-channels and specific back-end services without the need for individual whitelisting‚Ä¢ Implemented pre-processing and post-processing filters for dynamic request and response validation, enhancing security measures‚Ä¢ Slashed migration time of back-end services by 41% through the central secure gateway, ensuring a more agile infrastructureProject 2: Service Version Manager‚Ä¢ Designed the Spring Boot application facilitating the efficient controlled deployment of backend application versions based on user ID‚Ä¢ Enabled the selective exposure of new releases to 2% of users initially, with gradual expansion to 100%,resulting in a systematic rollout‚Ä¢ Achieved 31% increase in the efficiency of introducing new functional changes across applications and ensured a seamless transitionfor end-users during the application evolution process, showcasing a strategic approach to software updatesMiscellaneous‚Ä¢ Developed an AES-based encryption plugin with Cipher block chaining (CBC) algorithm and PKCS5Padding technique for ROLB Security‚Ä¢ Implemented a dynamic property refresh event listener in the gateway application, facilitating real-time configuration and availability‚Ä¢ Enabled logging of audit events in the library consumed by 100+ of multi-channel applications in FullServe with SLF4J using IOL Schema‚Ä¢ Increased test coverage of a legacy Java library from 79.3% to 86.5% with integration tests and unit tests using Junit and Mockito
experience.description_html: Project 1: Application Gateway Service‚Ä¢ Streamlined the security infrastructure by whitelisting the gateway application in the organization‚Äôs firewall, enabling seamless andsecure communication between external e-channels and specific back-end services without the need for individual whitelisting‚Ä¢ Implemented pre-processing and post-processing filters for dynamic request and response validation, enhancing security measures‚Ä¢ Slashed migration time of back-end services by 41% through the central secure gateway, ensuring a more agile infrastructureProject 2: Service Version Manager‚Ä¢ Designed the Spring Boot application facilitating the efficient controlled deployment of backend application versions based on user ID‚Ä¢ Enabled the selective exposure of new releases to 2% of users initially, with gradual expansion to 100%,resulting in a systematic rollout‚Ä¢ Achieved 31% increase in the efficiency of introducing new functional changes across applications and ensured a seamless transitionfor end-users during the application evolution process, showcasing a strategic approach to software updatesMiscellaneous‚Ä¢ Developed an AES-based encryption plugin with Cipher block chaining (CBC) algorithm and PKCS5Padding technique for ROLB Security‚Ä¢ Implemented a dynamic property refresh event listener in the gateway application, facilitating real-time configuration and availability‚Ä¢ Enabled logging of audit events in the library consumed by 100+ of multi-channel applications in FullServe with SLF4J using IOL Schema‚Ä¢ Increased test coverage of a legacy Java library from 79.3% to 86.5% with integration tests and unit tests using Junit and Mockito

experience.title: Full-stack Developer

experience.title: Java Software Engineer in QuantQA Team
experience.description: ‚Ä¢ Developed tools in Java to process information from CSV files and logged those to prescribed output formats‚Ä¢ Developed a tool to process 21 GiB of raw data in CSV files with rows containing up to 70,000 entries within 6 mins‚Ä¢ Improved run time by 27.3% and reduced RAM usage of a pre-existing tool in Java repository‚Ä¢ Converted some pre-existing tools in Python to JAVA and integrated with Git Java repository of the QuantQA team

projects: [{"title":"Fault Diagnosis in Air Conditioner","start_date":"Jul 2021","end_date":"Apr 2022","description":"Mentor: Prof. Aurobinda Routray, Dept of Electrical Engineering‚Ä¢ Automated fault detection in an air conditioner through an embedded system device using microservices and machine learning‚Ä¢ Obtained steady state and transient current signature of faulty air conditioners for different types of faults to train the ML model‚Ä¢ Designed an edge computing device to detect anomalies with 80.2% accuracy in the current signature and report to the cloud server‚Ä¢ Implemented RESTful API in SpringBoot to fetch the type of the fault in AC and displayed the result in UI built with ReactJS"},{"title":"Development of Sensorless BLDC Motor Driver","start_date":"Apr 2019","end_date":"Jun 2019","description":"Mentor: Prof. Santanu Kapat, Dept of Electrical Engineering‚Ä¢ Developed and tested an electronic driver for driving a brushless DC motor and minimized its torque ripple‚Ä¢ Used GaN MOSFET, FPGA to make and drive inverter circuit, and designed the board using Altium software"}]
